document.docAuthor: Ferrari, Rafael R., Niu, Ze-Qing, Kuhlmann, Michael, Zhang, Dan & Zhu, Chao- Dong
document.masterDocTitle: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Colletes haubrugei Kuhlmann, 2002: 1159
( holotype ♂ : China , Xizang , Saugang-Khangmar [ZMB]).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Colletes haubrugei
;
Niu et al. 2013b: 105
,
2014b: 475
; Ascher & Pickering 2021 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Colletes haubrugei Kuhlmann, 2002
. Female: (A) habitus, lateral view; (C) face, frontal view. Male: (B) habitus, lateral view; (D) face, frontal view; (E) genital capsule, lateral view; (F) S7, ventral view. Scale bars: (A–D) 2 mm; (E, F) 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Among the Tibetan
Colletes
, females of
C. haubrugei
can be readily diagnosed through the combination of relatively long malar area and F1, which are 1.25× as long as basal width of mandible and 1.4× as long as its apical width, respectively. Males are unique in having the combination of clypeus longer than broad and S5 with a pair of patches of inwardly-directed hairs apicolaterally.
Colletes haubrugei
is most similar to
C. hedini
, but these species can be differentiated by the hind basitarsus 3.25× as long as broad in females of
C. haubrugei
(hind basitarsus 3.75× as long as broad in females of
C. hedini
) and the metasomal terga with well-defined apical bands in males of
C. haubrugei
(apical bands either absent or indicated solely by slightly denser pubescence in males of
C. hedini
).

Distribution. Western China ( Sichuan and Xizang ).
DNA barcode. Available ( 3 ♀ ). See also Fig. 1 and Table 1 .

Remarks. The gonostylus of
C. haubrugei
is uniquely remarkably enlarged and broadened towards the apex ( Fig. 6E ), making the species unmistakable among all species of
Colletes
known to us.
